column4: ok, i am trying to unpack a gz file i downloaded, but it says the program doesnt have access to mkdir .... how do i give this program access to perform this?
extract the file in a folder your user has permissions in
or do   sudo tar zxvf filename.tar.gz
i am trying to save it into my home folder
using "archive manager"
that i'm not sure
so do i have to go command line everytime i need to uninstall a package?
ops, unpack*
it doesn't sound like you are installing packages as you are working with gz files?  Wouldn't that be source?
it's skype ... i just got it from their website ... it comes in a gz package
i think i'll have to extract and run ./configure
anyway, i wanted to stop ubuntu from asking my password ALL THE TIME, it's annoying
looks like UAC in Vista
you should download the .dev file for ubuntu set permissions on that to +x and execute it
there's no deb file
ohhh, yes, sorry ... i am trying skype AND songbird RC2
songbird is the one in gz file
but skype now is telling me it's wrong architecture i386 (i'm on x64)
i go command line when working on most things so not sure how to further assist on that
can i bypass this check on architecture? i had skype working in my previous x64 ubuntu install
probably need to go from source then on skype and configure from there
ok, thx, gonna give it a try
